Modification_Detail.description: Added Alias_List; revised description for consistency with other Venera products; added External_References

External_Reference.reference_text: Vernov, S. N., Tverskoy, B. A., Volga, V. N., Volodin, E. Ya., Galachyev, N. G., Getselev, I. V., Gorchakov, E. V., Ignatiev, P. P., Iozenas, V. A., Kontor, N. N., Lyubimov, G. P., Ternovskaya, M. V., Tkachenko, V. I., Chuchkov, E. A., Shvidkovskaya, T. E., Yakovlev, V. A., Measurement of cosmic rays on space probes Venera-9 and Venera-10, Kosmicheskie Issledovaniya, vol. 14, no. 6, 857-868, 1976.

Instrument.name: Venera 9 Energetic Particles, MSU-TASPD
Instrument.description: The Venera 9 Energetic Particles experiment was a Soviet suite of particle detectors that monitored the flux of charged particles of medium energies in interplanetary space during cruise and Venus orbit, specifically measuring protons (>30 MeV) from the sunward direction; protons (4-12 MeV) from the anti-sunward direction; and protons (>800 MeV) from all directions. Detectors also measured 1-5 MeV protons from the sunward direction; 0.3-5 MeV protons from anti-sunward direction; and >1 MeV protons and >0.05 MeV electrons but the data returned were not usable.
